normalised: The air is thick with anticipation, louder than the drums during a Ganpati visarjan. It is transfer season in the Pro Kabaddi League (P K L), and the teams are shuffling players like a deck of cards before a high-stakes poker game at a Diwali party. It is the 'Kabaddi Ka Chakkar Chalao' time, as they say in the villages!

normalised: Forget the I P L auctions, the real strategic brilliance shines here. Teams are looking to plug holes in their defense, boost their raiding power, and find that diamond in the rough – the player who will pull off a do-or-die raid that leaves the opposition stunned. Think of it like the plot of a Bollywood movie – underdog teams finding their heroes and overcoming impossible odds. Reminds you of 'Chak De! India' does not it? Except with more grappling and less hockey.
